byline.original: By NICK CUMMING-BRUCE and RICK GLADSTONE
byline.contributor: Nick Cumming-Bruce reported from Geneva, and Rick Gladstone from New York.

lead_paragraph: An advocacy group leaks documents that it says showed the United Nations was slow to act on accusations that French soldiers were abusing boys in the Central African Republic.

headline.print_headline: Group Questions Response by U.N. in Abuse Inquiry
headline.main: U.N. Role Is Questioned in Sexual Abuse Inquiry

snippet: An advocacy group leaks documents that it says showed the United Nations was slow to act on accusations that French soldiers were abusing boys in the Central African Republic.
abstract: Advocacy group AIDS-Free World publishes leaked United Nations documents that group says point to a wider awareness among senior UN human rights officials that French soldiers sexually abused children in Central African Republic than was previously thought; also accuses officials of a cover up.
